definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: Bill didn't go to college, now that he was apprenticed to a carpenter.
sentences.chinese: 貝爾沒有去上大學，因爲他學徒做了木匠。

sentences.english: The boy was apprenticed to a bricklayer.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩子被送給一個泥瓦匠當學徒。

sentences.english: His father apprenticed him to a linen draper.
sentences.chinese: 他父親把他送去跟亞麻織品零售商當學徒。

sentences.english: This centre ensures that Riviera can continue to develop its apprentices' and employees' personal growth.
sentences.chinese: 這個中心確保了裏維埃拉的學徒和員工的個人成長。

sentences.english: In my youth my father bound me to a blacksmith.
sentences.chinese: 在我年輕時我父親立契讓我給一名鐵匠當學徒。

sentences.english: My son is an apprentice in a furniture maker's workshop.
sentences.chinese: 我的兒子在一家傢俱廠裏當學徒工。

sentences.english: He was bound out to a blacksmith for three years.
sentences.chinese: 根據契約，他拜一位鐵匠爲師當三年學徒。

sentences.english: Wu Kang was a shiftless fellow who changed apprenticeships all the time.
sentences.chinese: 吳剛是個怠懈而又不學有數的學徒。

sentences.english: The month's trial over, oliver was formally apprenticed.
sentences.chinese: 一個月的試用期已經過去，奧立弗正式成爲學徒。

sentences.english: She is a satisfaction to the parents and guardians of the prentices.
sentences.chinese: 那個學徒的父母和監護人對她很滿意。

sentences.english: She apprenticed with the great master.
sentences.chinese: 她師從這位著名的大師當學徒。

sentences.english: At an early age, I was apprenticed to a carpenter.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候曾給木匠當過學徒。

sentences.english: Who's show did Borden and Angier attend when they were still apprentices?
sentences.chinese: 波登和安傑爾兩人還是學徒時，去看了誰的表演？

sentences.english: Among them generally were female domestic servants and female apprentices.
sentences.chinese: 女僕大致包括女家僕以及女學徒兩類。

sentences.english: Some say the phrase goes back to a practice of early apprenticeships.
sentences.chinese: 有人說這句話可以追溯到早期學徒的實踐。

sentences.english: The young apprentis is pretty afraid of his boss.
sentences.chinese: 小學徒對老闆怕得要死。

definition: to learn a skill or art
master/qualified worker/respectful form of address for older men/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
to hold an office or post
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
